pTitle: PUR 18 Cup Water Filtration Dispenser w/ 1 Filter
rText: This is my first ever water purifier. Never needed one before because water usually tastes just fine to me out of the tap (most of the time). Unfortunately I moved into a place that does not have filtered water and it tastes absolutely horrific so I considered all my options and thought a water purifier would be the way to go. I didn't want to spend a lot and I couldn't have it take too much space in the fridge either. I also needed more that just a typical pitcher size. I ordered this lovely 18cup Pur as well as 3 filters to replace when needed. Followed the directions on the filter and in no time had some cool, delicious water to drink. It says you should change the filter every 40 gallons or about every 2 months but you might want to rethink that and gauge how much your family uses. Why? Well, because I found all these tiny black particles left over on the top part of the dispenser (that got filtered out of my drinking water on the bottom). It made me wonder what else is in my water. I also noticed that things started tasting a bit funny or weird like my coffee. We use the filtered water for everything to do with cooking/drinking because our tap is absolutely terrible. So, it only took me about 4 days to figure we use on average 3.75 quarts/day (family of 2) so technically for us it means we'd use 40 gallons in about 43 days. Everyone is different, maybe you don't drink as much or use it for cooking/coffee machine or alternate between bottled waters and it may last you longer but I feel the filters are inexpensive enough to be changed when needed. Love this! Easy to clean, slim design, no issues.

pDescr: Drink healthier, great tasting tap water with this BPA free Brita 10 cup water pitcher. With the Advanced filter technology, Brita cuts the taste and odor of chlorine to deliver great tasting water, and is certified to reduce copper, cadmium and mercury impurities, which can adversely affect your health over time. The Brita water pitcher's flip top lid makes refilling a breeze and just a glance at the sticker filter indicator lets you know when it is time to change the Brita replacement filter. This large water pitcher comes with 1 water filter, which should be changed every 40 gallons or about 2 months for best results. Start drinking healthier, great tasting water with Brita today.

rText: We did a series of tests between the LongLast Brita pitcher filter, a standard Brita pitcher filter, a Zerowater filter designed for the Brita pitcher, distilled water from a Durastill water distiller and plain tap water. The testing device came with the Zerowater filters. The tests involved cleaning the pitcher after each test. We could not accurately estimate the device that came with Zerowater filters. With that mind the distilled water tested at 003 ppm (particulates per million); the Zerowater filter was 004 ppm; the standard Brita filter was 111 ppm, the Brita Longlast filter was 134 ppm and our tap water was 138 ppm. The tests were conducted twice for accuracy. Unfortunately we found the Longlast filter producing water no better than our tap water..
rTitle: Brita Longlast filter fails a local water test

pDescr:
Product Description
The GE Profile Reverse Osmosis Replacement Filter Set reduces more than 10 contaminants in your drinking water, including chlorine-resistant cysts, lead and asbestos. Includes a pre- and post-filter replacement set compatible with the PXRQ15RBL system and made with "twist and lock" technology, providing for simple and easy filter installation Recommended replacement every 6 months or 900 gallons for fresh, filtered water. NSF/ANSI certified.

From the Manufacturer
The GE Smart Water FQROPF lasts for up to 6 months (900 gallons) and is a great water filter for improving the flavor of hot and cold beverages including coffee, tea, and juices.
pTitle: GE Profile FQROPF Reverse Osmosis Replacement Filter Set
rText: Genuine oem filters at a really good price. I have ordered from them before and will continue to do so.
rTitle: Genuine oem filters at a really good price. I have ordered from them before and ...

pDescr:
Product Description
The GE Profile Reverse Osmosis Replacement Filter Set reduces more than 10 contaminants in your drinking water, including chlorine-resistant cysts, lead and asbestos. Includes a pre- and post-filter replacement set compatible with the PXRQ15RBL system and made with "twist and lock" technology, providing for simple and easy filter installation Recommended replacement every 6 months or 900 gallons for fresh, filtered water. NSF/ANSI certified.

From the Manufacturer
The GE Smart Water FQROPF lasts for up to 6 months (900 gallons) and is a great water filter for improving the flavor of hot and cold beverages including coffee, tea, and juices.

pTitle: GE Profile FQROPF Reverse Osmosis Replacement Filter Set
rText: I had this system for just over 2 years. It gave me so much headache. I recalled when this system first use, no problem. 6 months pass, I started ordering filters from Amazon, original GE, the problem started. The water produced slow and slow untill no water, GE service extended my warranty 1/2 year, but the service charged still applied, the system fixed, I also changed membrance filter as well. The time passed, I just have only one time filters replacement without any problem. The nightmare kept going... I finally gave up and replace another brand new system so no more headache.

pTitle: Culligan FM-25 Faucet Mount Filter with Advanced Water Filtration, Chrome Finish
rText:
This little Culligan filter was my choice for an on-faucet filter after my previous one sprouted leaks. I compared the specs of several brands and decided to give this little one a try - less expensive system, including replacement filters and good ratings from a trustworthy consumers' test organization. I decided to purchase the chrome model to attach to the sink, but will buy white replacement filters.

One online reviewer reported that the filter was "very difficult to remove and replace," so, before I attached it to the faucet, I decided to remove the filter - just to see how. wow.... I am so glad I did! It took me a couple minutes to figure out exactly where it was supposed to come apart. An online video helped with that. It *was* a real challenge for me, even with tools to help, but I managed okay.

Now that I know how it comes apart, I might just remove it from the faucet while changing the filters. (Been using it a couple months, so that process may happen soon.)

Two things I like a lot about this little gadget - the filtered water is just what I hoped for to make a good cup of tea.... and.... I LOVE the pull-knob that engages the bypass to the filter. So easy, and it automatically pops back in when the water is turned off!

Note: After I've used it for a while, I may revisit my rating; it's too new for 5 stars.

pTitle: Culligan FM-25 Faucet Mount Filter with Advanced Water Filtration, Chrome Finish
rText: I owned the Culligan white version for 5-7 years before it started leaking and had to be replaced. This one, like the previous model, attached easily to my existing tap without any additional hardware . . . and presto -- no leaks at all. It removes the taste of chlorine and other undesirable things. The chrome finish is a definite plus, and the water flow out of the tap seems improved even when the filter is turned off.

pTitle: Culligan FM-25 Faucet Mount Filter with Advanced Water Filtration, Chrome Finish
rText:
This was our second purchase. The first one broke within warranty and was replaced without an issue. The replacement eventually broke again, lasting a combined total of about 3 years. We liked the filter and the taste of the water in particular (no chlorine taste) so we decided to buy a new one. However, the cartridge that came with it was painfully slow, taking almost a minute to fill a 12 oz glass. We then ordered a replacement cartridge which had very fast flow and left most of the chlorine taste in the water. We are returning the replacement cartridge. I would like a refund of the filter itself, but we waited too long to try the second filter (deadline to request it was June 2nd).

It is my impression that quality has severely dropped, which is unfortunate since we really liked this filter despite durability issues.

Fine otherwise.

pTitle: Culligan FM-25 Faucet Mount Filter with Advanced Water Filtration, Chrome Finish
rText: My wife and I have enjoyed using this Culligan filter for the past year. Our municipal water supply is fine for showers and clothes but is frankly awful to drink. This filter cleans up all the odor and taste, yielding a clear and enjoyable glass of water. One star off because the filters are so difficult to change. They are easy to install but seem to fuse in place and are a pain to remove.
rTitle: My wife and I have enjoyed using this Culligan filter for the past year

pDescr: Drink healthier, great tasting tap water with this BPA free Brita 10 cup water pitcher. With the Advanced filter technology, Brita cuts the taste and odor of chlorine to deliver great tasting water, and is certified to reduce copper, cadmium and mercury impurities, which can adversely affect your health over time. The Brita water pitcher's flip top lid makes refilling a breeze and just a glance at the sticker filter indicator lets you know when it is time to change the Brita replacement filter. This large water pitcher comes with 1 water filter, which should be changed every 40 gallons or about 2 months for best results. Start drinking healthier, great tasting water with Brita today.

pTitle: Brita 10 Cup Everyday BPA Free Water Pitcher with 1 Filter, White
rText: I wanted a Brita pitcher with more water capacity and this is it !!! I love the design and it works great as all of their pitchers do. I am sixty years old and I will have to get used to the increased weight but it is doable for sure. I drink a lot of water and I got tired of filling up my smaller Brita pitcher multiple times a day. I especially like the sleek comfortable handle though, I would like it even better if the handle base went lower on the main part. I also don't need the extra space on the lid for the timing sticker. I would rather have a longer top area to grip when removing the lid. I time my filter refills by marking a new filter on top with the month and day in permanent marker and letting that dry before using. I like this method since I see the date everytime I refill the pitcher and yet the info it is out of view. I guess the sticker is great for some people.
rTitle: Great Size. Sleek comfortable Handle too !!

This large water pitcher comes with 1 water filter, which should be changed every 40 gallons or about 2 months for best results. Start drinking healthier, great tasting water with Brita today.
pTitle: Brita 10 Cup Everyday BPA Free Water Pitcher with 1 Filter, White
rText: Much faster filtering than expected. Handy and does not take much space. Helps reduce hard minerals in water, but without a big expensive filter system we cannot expect more. Well satisfied.

pDescr: Not Available
pTitle: Soma Replacement Water Filters (2 Filters) â€“ Filters Mercury, Chlorine, Taste and Odor, Zinc, and Copper â€“ NSF Standard 53 & 42 Certified
rText:
It's rare that I care about/review a kitchen product, but this caught me off guard. What is it you care about? Aesthetics? Sustainability? Convenience? Health? These little guys have it all. This is the best water filter pitcher and I've tried them all (meaning at least 4).
I know this is a review about the filters, but they are the engine that runs the whole Soma product. The filters clean up all the bad stuff in the water with a quick drip (that matters when you just got back from a run and can't bring yourself to pollute your body with sink water), the whole pitcher looks good enough to put on your table (no more being embarrassed by a pitcher that rhymes with critta), the ingenious refill hole/system saves you time and fumbling, and the whole company runs with a heart that cares about people and our environment (coconut carbon in a plant based filter). If you don't want to ditch your pitcher and buy a Soma you're not fit to make adult decisions.
rTitle: Only buy this if you like your water clean, easy, and fast

rText: This is great- Lasts much longer than my old filter, even the filter on my fridge water dispenser! Super easy to take out and replace as well!

pDescr: Not Available
pTitle: Soma Replacement Water Filters (2 Filters) â€“ Filters Mercury, Chlorine, Taste and Odor, Zinc, and Copper â€“ NSF Standard 53 & 42 Certified
rText: I honestly love my Soma water pitcher. I did a lot of research before buying this pitcher along with the water filters. The filter is made of coconut shell carbon with a plant-based casing and it filters out the yucky stuff like mercury, copper, zinc and chlorine. Tastes good. This is the only filter out there thatâ€™s compostable which I love. Because the design is so pretty- I donâ€™t hide it away like I used to do with my Brita.. which is actually making me drink more water â˜º Great company.. actively involved with charity water which led me to buy one of their pretty water bottles too (see pic).

pDescr:
Color:Mod Columns
Whether youâ€™re at the gym, on your bike or on the soccer field, enjoy great-tasting water anywhere, with a Brita Sport Water Filter Bottle. The water filter, which sits inside the 20-ounce soft-sided bottle, filters as you drink. It reduces particulates as well as the taste and odor of chlorine, often found in tap water. Just fill the squeezable plastic water bottle, screw on the cap, pull up the nozzle and hydrate with cleaner water for pennies per gallon. This filter bottle features a modern design of grey, white and orange columns. Itâ€™s BPA-free and dishwasher safe on the top rack, making cleaning easy. For optimum performance, change the water filter every 40 gallons or 2 months. When replacing the filter, look for item number 60258 35818 - the black Brita Bottle Replacement Filters. One filter can replace up to 300 standard 16.9-ounce water bottles, cutting down on plastic waste. Get great taste, less waste and more savings from Brita.

I've been using my bottle for about 2 months and at first it worked like a charm, but in the past couple of weeks it's become increasingly difficult to pull the cap open and push it back closed. I'd love if they designed a larger ounce sport bottle (they have them in the hard sided bottles, but the hard sided bottles leak). I LOVE being able to fill a bottle anywhere for filtered water rather than buying water bottles - what a waste!

pDescr:
Uses 2 Separate UF Membrane Filters and a Carbon Filter for 0.01 Micron Filtration

	
Does your Portable Water Filter also Filter Taste and Metals?
Â 

Introducing the Survivor Filter PRO: With 2 cleanable Membrane Ultra Filters capable of filtering down to 0.01 Microns. We also added a replaceable Carbon Filter, to help with taste and reduce Heavy Metals. The Survivor Filter PRO provides you with clean water in any environment.
Â 

Get yourself a Survivor Filter PRO and taste the difference!
Access Clean Water When Traveling, Preparing, Camping, Hunting and Backpacking Like Never Before!

	
Pump into Hydration Device or Attachable Cup: Get fast filtered water directly from nature. Flow rate of 17 ounces (500ml) per minute. Perfect for large groups and families.
Â 
Â 
Can Be Backwashed in the Wild: The Survivor Filterâ€™s Dual Membrane Ultra Filters are designed to last 100,000 Liters (26,417 gallons) and can be easily back-flushed and cleaned in the wild for extended water filtration. This product is built for long-term use and emergency situations.Â Â 
Lightweight and Durably Constructed

	
Designed for Rugged Outdoor Use: The Survivor Filter is designed to take a beating with its FDA approved, BPA Free ABS Durable Material. There is a Steel Draw Bar under the plastic handle to add strength and durability. The product shell has been tested to withstand up to 250 pounds of pressure.
Â 
Â 
Packs Easy and Takes Up Little Space: Compact design weighs only 3.5 ounces (100 grams) and is 7 inches long. Easily fits in your backpack or emergency kit.Â 
Comes Assembled with Everything you See Hereâ€¦.

	
Specifications:
Â 
Filtration Level: 0.01 Microns
Weight: 10.5 Ounces (300 grams)
Size: 6.5 x 1.97 x 3.15 inches
Capacity: UF Filter 100,000 Liters (26,417 Gallons), Carbon Filter 2,000 liters (528 Gallons)
Flow Rate: 17 Ounces Per Minute (500 ml/min)
Â 

Test Specifications:
Â 
Independently tested in the USA (Intertek Labs in Columbus Ohio) to remove Bacteria, Staph, and Virus (Phi X174) to 99.9% and significantly reduce Heavy Metals. Also easily eliminates Giardia, Protozoa and Parasites from the water.
Â 
Â

rText:
A physical overview looks great. Compared to another brand I own , Sawyer.... straw .1 Micron (drank from both Mountain ranges with)
The level of physical filtration (not purifier) this offers is amazing.
This I have not field tested yet. Will put up against Our science Lab.
Holding title of Operations Engineer, Certified in several Trades. Means nothing..
I have done lots of research. On Microns and elements in the worst possible worldly of out comes. First wash-bucket then ~ SFP ~
To filter fallout through a wash bucket of earth that you pulled below 6 inches from the topsoil with sand at top and bottom. Iodine 131 (Rads') would be cut out. Fallout 4 followers...
But still flood your system with good potassium Iodine, so you don't intake the bad.
Nothing is perfect.

After talking to there staff they seem very genuinely conscious of products they supply.
I had given several suggestions on product Ideas and up grades. The man said they valued it enough to refund me. Didn't happen wasn't paid or given product for this review.
If I get it back or not it is money well spent.
I tell you I am hard to please. Very Satisfied.... (updated)
rTitle: Quality, at fair price compared to others. avid traveler, Hiker, camper, this is going in the what if Bag.

The recommended method of soaking in vinegar is not viable in a survival setting.

pTitle: Survivor Filter PRO 0.01 Micron Water Purifier Pump. Emergency and Camping Survival Gear. 3-Stage Nanofiltration Water Filter - 2 Separate 100,000L Membrane UF Filters that Can Be Cleaned and a Replaceable Carbon Filter. Also Comes With an Attachable Water Cup, Extended Hoses, Hose Clip and a Free Zippered Carrying Case
rText: I am only just acquiring the tools needed for backpacking/camping; I deemed this tool to be at the top of the list. Through research I found the Survivor Filter PRO .01 Micron Water Filter to be the most thorough portable/pack-able device within my budget. The life of the multi-filter mechanism seems more than I'll need for this season, and again, pricing for replacement filters is most reasonable for the lifetime advertised (check out the half-off purchase program as well if you're a high-frequency adventurer, and look forward to a generous coupon after buying as well). As I'm new to all this, I've relied on customer reviews as well as manufacturer willingness to answer questions...very positive on both accounts; the manufacturer personally reached out to make certain my item was delivered on time and to answer any questions I may have had. I look forward to using my new filter sooner than later, and will surely update my review with actual first-time-user experience. I am very confident I've made a great choice.

Emergency and Camping Survival Gear. 3-Stage Nanofiltration Water Filter - 2 Separate 100,000L Membrane UF Filters that Can Be Cleaned and a Replaceable Carbon Filter. rText:
I bought this specifically for hiking. I looked at several other products, but this product seemed to be the safest bet for my hydration bladder. I tested it out on high mountain streams that were mostly clear with a bit of a milky look to them and the water came out of the filter tasting brilliant and completely clear ! Much better than my tap water at home!
I did end up losing the little tube clip before I got to the first use, but managed well enough without it. It really works better if you have two people if you're using any kind of collapsable container: one person to pump (it's a two handed job) and one person to hold the container open.

rText:
My First Need filter blew out on me after a few years. I bought this at the last minute for a canoeing trip on Lake Powell. It is light, simple, and effective. Have used it on two multi-day trips, once in pretty gross water. Performed flawlessly - sweet water in your cup. 4-stars for slow output. You will want to find a pretty spot by the water to enjoy the view for filtering as you will be there for a while. Pump plunger material looks like it may snap on me some day.

All that being said - the product performed EXACTLY as promised and the price cant be beat.

rText: Took this filter on a 5 day backpacking trip and it was easily able to provide refills while hiking throughout the day. We used this in conjunction with a Katadyn filter and the flavor from this was far superior. The only negative is that the filter on the hose got clogged after about 8 liters and backflushing it was very hard to do. This was drawing from a fast moving stream with clear water, so I am worried about using it in anything worse.

pTitle: Survivor Filter PRO 0.01 Micron Water Purifier Pump. Emergency and Camping Survival Gear. 3-Stage Nanofiltration Water Filter - 2 Separate 100,000L Membrane UF Filters that Can Be Cleaned and a Replaceable Carbon Filter. Also Comes With an Attachable Water Cup, Extended Hoses, Hose Clip and a Free Zippered Carrying Case
rText:
Have owned this for about 6 months now and used it on a backpacking trip for the first time a month ago. I admit to have leaving it packed up for a week after getting back. I took it apart following the instructions, cleaned it well, and left it to dry on the kitchen sink. A few days later the filters still seemed damp so I let sit until the following weekend. Started putting it back together and when I pushed the pump handle down some water came out of the output port. ??? Ok, so it's still not dry. Took it apart and let it sit for another two weeks. It's in a well ventilated area and today I put it back together and the same thing ... compressed the pump handle and some water came out again (only a few drops, but still, what the heck?). I don't want to put it away damp ... that's just asking for bacteria / mold trouble. How long does it take these filters to dry out?

Oh ... should mention how it worked in the field, eh? :-) When it was time to resupply the water containers we had a nice running stream to collect from. First obstacle I ran into was trying to keep the prefilter under water. Moved the float back to about 12 inches from the end, and ended up just putting a small rock on the intake tube to hold the prefilter under water. Pumping was not easy, although not overly difficult either. Could be challenging for maybe a youth to handle. I think this will get better (easier) after a couple of uses (from what I've read by other reviews). Ended up refilling my 70 oz camelbak and a couple of 32 water bottles. The water tasted great! Just like our sweet well water at home.
rTitle: Like it overall. Want to like it more - hopefully eventually. :-)

pTitle: Survivor Filter PRO 0.01 Micron Water Purifier Pump. Emergency and Camping Survival Gear. 3-Stage Nanofiltration Water Filter - 2 Separate 100,000L Membrane UF Filters that Can Be Cleaned and a Replaceable Carbon Filter. Also Comes With an Attachable Water Cup, Extended Hoses, Hose Clip and a Free Zippered Carrying Case
rText:
Seems like a good little unit. Took it out of the box, took it apart, put it back together again and flushed several liters of product through it.
No issues... @ 71 cycles to produce a liter of water.
Packed along on a 3 day trip in the Eastern Sierra and even though I really didn't need to filter the water (I've been drinking the stuff straight from the source for 45 years) due to the massive snow melt, I did cycle a few liters of water through it... No after taste that could detect.
Only concern is that upon reaching home, I cycled some RO drinking water through it "just in case" to clear it and let it "dry" for most of a full day.
Still, the carbon filter produced some water upon shaking it out and I even pumped some compressed air (10 psi) through it and it still sputtered out some moisture after 3 days.... Put it back in it's handy carrying case and waited a few days to check on it... Pulled it out and shook out the element and it still had some moisture in in... After 2 weeks I took another look at it was finally dry. Not sure I want that water sitting in that filter for "weeks" on end... Makes me worry just a bit about "bugs" growing in that carbon filter area while being stored. Perhaps the OEM can advise on this?
Would probably purchase again given the quality and price point. We'll see how it holds up during the summer trekking schedule.
rTitle: Seems like a good little unit

pDescr:
Size:Standard - 1ct
Product Description
Keep tap water healthier and tasting better when you regularly change your Brita replacement filter. Made to fit all Brita pitchers and dispensers, this replacement filter reduces copper, mercury and cadmium impurities that can adversely affect your health over time, while cutting chlorine taste and odor to deliver great tasting water. Designed to leave no black flecks in your water and with no pre-soak required, the Brita filters are quick and easy to use. Change your Brita filters every 40 gallons or approximately 2 months for best performance. Start drinking healthier, great tasting water with Brita today.

From the Manufacturer
Water pitcher filter for use with all Brita pitchers. Provides healthier, clear, refreshing water. Reduces sediment and chlorine-the cause of taste and odor. Replace every 40-Gallons (about every 2 months for the average family). Measures 5 by 2 by 2-Inch
pTitle: Brita Replacement Water Filter for Pitchers, 1 Count
rText: I figured I'd give his a try since it made sense in the long run, not having to change filters so often. Don't waste your time with this, it's a scam!

pTitle: Brita Replacement Water Filter for Pitchers, 1 Count
rText: We did a series of tests between the LongLast Brita pitcher filter, a standard Brita pitcher filter, a Zerowater filter designed for the Brita pitcher, distilled water from a Durastill water distiller and plain tap water. The testing device came with the Zerowater filters. The tests involved cleaning the pitcher after each test. We could not accurately estimate the device that came with Zerowater filters. With that mind the distilled water tested at 003 ppm (particulates per million); the Zerowater filter was 004 ppm; the standard Brita filter was 111 ppm, the Brita Longlast filter was 134 ppm and our tap water was 138 ppm. The tests were conducted twice for accuracy. Unfortunately we found the Longlast filter producing water no better than our tap water..
rTitle: Brita Longlast filter fails a local water test

Change your Brita filters every 40 gallons or approximately 2 months for best performance. Start drinking healthier, great tasting water with Brita today.

From the Manufacturer
Water pitcher filter for use with all Brita pitchers. Provides healthier, clear, refreshing water. Reduces sediment and chlorine-the cause of taste and odor. Replace every 40-Gallons (about every 2 months for the average family). Measures 5 by 2 by 2-Inch

pTitle: Kabter Healthy Faucet Water Filter System for Bathroom and Kitchen,Chrome
rText:
Close your eyes and pretend you live in roughly the 15th largest city in the U.S. and rent a house that was built in 1900. After the Flint water crisis, your city puts out a statement saying there's no danger of lead in the water and that the city does regular tests.

Now imagine you later find out their version of testing is only going to something like 15 random houses and testing the tap water every year or two. That doesn't inspire a lot of confidence, does it? Especially when your house may have been gutted and redone within the past 10 years, so lead paint isn't an issue, but water pipes are pretty much there to stay.

Finally, imagine your city later puts out of map of the city water lines and where they suspect there may be lead pipes. You take a look and not only are you surrounded on all sides by suspected lead pipes, the entire neighborhood and all the neighborhoods around it all have lead pipes. Granted, lead pipes don't mean lead in the water, but after seeing your house surrounded by red lines, in your mind it might as well be circled by little pictures of skulls and crossbones.

This is where I found myself and why I so quickly snatched this filter from Amazon. The water coming into my house may not be the same as licking a brick made of every toxic substance you can imagine, but my screaming subconscious doesn't much care about better tasting water (honestly, the difference in amazing. Installed this yesterday and I will never have coffee again that doesn't start from filtered water), it cares about not being slowly poisoned to death.

Long story long, my water tastes amazing now. So does my coffee. And my "Danger, Will Robinson!" subconscious feels much, much safer.
rTitle: For anyone whose brain has convinced itself their water is possessed by lead, the devil, and the souls of 1,000 evil witches

Check your faucet at first, if there is an aerator on the faucet spout, unscrew it. 
1. Faucets with outside threaded: The outside threaded diameter is about 21.5mm. 
2. Faucets with inner threaded: The innner threaded diameter is about 23.5mm. 
3. Faucets without threaded : The outside diameter is 15~21mm. 
4. Other style faucets : Please give us pictures ,we will help you make sure it. 

Note: 
1.For fresh clean water, please replace the cartridge filter every 3-5 months.
2.First use, the water came out black for a second, because there is granular carbon in the filter.

Product Function
The faucet filter filled with carbon fiber and granular carbon ,KDF55, 
That can reduce contaminantsï¼ˆlike sediment, chlorine, cysts, benzene, asbestos, mercury & leadï¼‰
KDF55 also can kills bacteria and inhibits the growth of scale, lime, mold, and fungi. 
Improves the taste, benefit drinking pureness and cooking for healthy life

pDescr:
Enjoy fresh, great tasting water right at home that is perfect for drinking, cooking and making delicious coffee, tea and ice. ROES-50 guaranteed to remove up to 99% of harmful water contaminants such as chlorine, taste, odor, VOCs, as well as toxic fluoride, sodium, arsenic, lead, nitrates, heavy metals and much more. Save money, time, and hassle from buying costly bottled water and live healthier with safe, contaminant free drinking water. Every ROES-50 is put through a rigorous quality control process to eliminate the slightest component imperfection, ensuring a smoother running system that is free from noises, leaks and clogs.Compared to cost cutting plastic or frame-less designed systems that require total disassembly of the system in order to change filters, the APEC premium metal framed construction prevents kinks and leaks in tubing damage,while prohibiting vibration and noises. It also makes identifying and replacing filters intuitive and effortless. The pro-grade leak-free housings holds super capacity block filters that offers 2X the capacity, higher contaminant rejection rate compare to smaller all-in-one filters, making ROES-50 virtually maintenance free. Rated at 50 GPD, the non-acidic high flow membrane provides fast flow rate with no wait time. With 2 decades of experience in RO design and production, APEC Water is committed in producing top performing, competitively priced systems that provides trouble-free, high quality drinking water for many years to come.
Premium quality system, using only NSF certified components guaranteeing contaminant free pure water
50 GPD non-acidic high flow membrane with high flow filters and tubing provides super-fast flow rate and no wait time for drinking water
Unlimited supply of bottled quality drinking water by removing chlorine, taste, odors and up to 99% of harmful contaminants found in tap water
Large high capacity solid block filters deliver 2x the contaminant removing capacity and fewer filter change outs compared to smaller low capacity filters
Solid metal framed construction prevents kink and leaks in tubing damage, while also prohibiting vibration and noises
Simple and organized, the ROES-50 is designed to make identifying and replacing filters intuitive and easy
Eco-friendly system with water saving design which includes low rinse water ratio and automatic shut off feature
Every ROES-50 includes a high quality, lead-free designer faucet in a chrome colored finish
Comes with complete filter set, system head, filter housings, color coded tubing, 4 Gal. storage tank, luxury designer faucet, installation kit and detailed owner's manual
pTitle: Essence Premium Quality 5-Stage Under-Sink Reverse Osmosis Drinking Water Filter System
rText: I got this system to have pure water for drinking and it was a breeze to install. The instructions were simple to follow and I had no isssues with them. I did not mount the filter housing as the instructions say you dont have to and it makes it easier to change out filters when you dont. I would recommend this product or any Apec product! Note: If you have granite counter tops you will need a special drill to make the hole for the spigot. Its a 1/2" drill meant for granite. You will also need some plumbers putty to make a pool of water around the cut being made to prevent overheating the drill.

pTitle: Essence Premium Quality 5-Stage Under-Sink Reverse Osmosis Drinking Water Filter System
rText: I was looking for a good water filter system with our recent kitchen remodel. Home Depot was carrying this 5-stage RO filter system at reasonable price. I tested my tap water (230ppm) and compared it to the RO water (13ppm) produced by this system. That's 1/20 of the particulates found in tap and 1/7 of the particulates found in Arrowhead bottled water. The system was easy to install and works like a charm. No longer do I need to go out and buy bottled water. Highly recommended!

pTitle: Essence Premium Quality 5-Stage Under-Sink Reverse Osmosis Drinking Water Filter System
rText: The system was very easy to install (I am a single, 52 year old woman and did it alone). I cannot believe how much better my coffee tastes with my purified water, and I can also now drink water without fear of what I am putting in my body. I also give it to my animals who are lapping up water faster than before! Another bonus is not having to deal with plastic bottle waste, especially in a small rural town that has no recycling program. I was a little concerned after I ran one cleaning cycle of water through the tank and then noticed the water was full of bubbles which clouded the water, but I read the troubleshooting guide and realized that the bubbles are normal on a new system, and they did eventually clear up.
rTitle: The system was very easy to install (I am a single, 52 year old woman and did it alone). I canno...

rText:
I removed my Automatic Dish Washer from under the counter and made the space available for the RO System. The instructions for installation were clear and easy to follow. I did have to add a rubber washer as a spacer for the Faucet between the Chrome Base and the Sink Top because the Black Location Washer had too tall a bevel. Once that was solved everything went perfect on the installation. The product works very efficiently and cleans the water perfectly. The TDS Meter showed tap water as 693 and RO System water as 24 and that is very acceptable.
I do highly recommend this APEC Reverse Osmosis System to everyone who wants clean drinking water.

pTitle: Essence Premium Quality 5-Stage Under-Sink Reverse Osmosis Drinking Water Filter System
rText: The filter was professionally installed which did not seem to be that easy. After installation the tank was drained three times, but there was still a slight taste. This was reported to the company and the rep who handled my call was very concerned. She told me to turn off the tank valve, open the faucet and let it drip for a few minutes while she remained on the line for the results. This made very little difference, but since I had called, she offered to send a free TDS meter and said the unit could be returned. Since then, water taste has considerably improved and we are very happy with our Essence 50, especially the company's courtesy and helpfulness.

pDescr:
These Replacement Filters for GE SmartWater System (2-Pack) work to reduce sand, soil, silt, sediment, dirt, rust and chlorine in your drinking water for improved taste and odor. These filters are compatible with GE household filtration system models GXWH20 and GXWH04. With NSF approved filtration quality and up to a 3-month filtration life per filter, these filters are designed for consistent filtration with low maintenance.
Whole home filtration system Filtered water for your whole home
Includes two filters, compatible with GXWH04F and GXWH20S systems and most systems with 10 in. x 2.5 in. filtersc
Premium filtration Certified to reduce sand, soil, rust and chlorine taste and odor in your water, appliances and plumbing fixtures
3-month filter life for best filtration results, filters should be replaced every three months or 30,000 Gal.
pTitle: Household Replacement Filters
rText: We've been buying these regularly since our new house was built. We've probably used more than we would normally because we are still making the sure the system is clear. These filters have been doing a great job.

pTitle: Household Replacement Filters
rText:
I have been using these filters for 17 years now with great results. These filters trap sediment and the charcoal absorbs odors and other things that would make your water taste bad.
Overall I would recommend these to anyone that has a whole house water filter.
